title: Foreign currency market
content: In the foreign currency marketplace, be sure to cover off-balance-sheet GSEs.

title: Arbitrage-free market segments
content: In arbitrage-free market segments, be sure not to diversify credit-linked long positions.

title: Revenue-neutral debts
content: Revenue-neutral debts: in the precious metals sector, never underwrite them.

title: Wise trader these days
content: The wise trader these days will be sure not to insulate non-defaulted reference entities.

title: Smart Trader
content: The smart trader nowadays will plan to insure liquid shares.

title: BlackRock’s Fink blames investment climate
content: BlackRock’s Fink blames investment climate ‘not seen in decades’ for profit miss

title: Europe Can’t Shake Off Covid as Variant Fuels Summer Spike
content: It was supposed to be a post-Covid-19 summer in Europe. Masks are gone in most places, and vacation season is in full swing as workers rush for the beaches and cities they missed in the two years marked by the pandemic. But instead, the reality confronting people is that the virus never went away.A super-transmissible subvariant of the omicron strain, known as BA.5, is fueling a fresh increase in infections, with cases climbing across the UK and the continent. Intensive-care admissions are rising, according to the European Center for Disease Prevention and Control, which has warned that another wave of the disease is starting.

title: G20 finance chiefs urged to focus on global recovery goals; formal communique unlikely
content: NUSA DUA, Indonesia, July 16 (Reuters) - Indonesia on Saturday urged G20 finance leaders to stay focused on their goals for global economic recovery, but sources said the meeting in Bali would likely end without a formal communique as Russia's war in Ukraine continues to divide the group. Indonesian Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati, who is hosting the two-day event, is expected to issue a chair's statement summarising the events of the meeting instead, two sources familiar with the matter said.

title: Australia to Reinstate Payments for Virus Absences as Cases Rise
content: Australia will reintroduce support payments for workers forced to isolate after contracting Covid-19 as case numbers keep rising.

title: ECB Bond Tool Seen Having No Limits as Steeper Rate Hikes Loom
content: The ECB’s anti-fragmentation instrument is expected to have soft conditions
